definition: to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: Investigators have identified the bomber as Han Wushun.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员查证发现，这名男子名姓韩。

sentences.english: That's according to copies of search warrants released today.
sentences.chinese: 这是根据今天公布的搜查证的副本文件所得知的。

sentences.english: The detectives swore out a search warrant.
sentences.chinese: 侦探宣誓所控属实后领到一张搜查证。
读程式码，理解它并查证它。

sentences.english: The nature of Coma's X-ray emission is still being investigated.
sentences.chinese: 后发星系团X射线发射的性质仍在查证中。

sentences.english: Checks stores requisitions and receipts against stock records.
sentences.chinese: 检查出库申请和库房收货，以查证库房记录是否正确。

sentences.english: The verification of the report took several days of cross-checking.
sentences.chinese: 报告的核实经过了好几天的多方查证。

sentences.english: Therefore the company was unrepresented when the search warrant was applied for and issued.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在申请和签发搜查证时，并无公司代表在。

sentences.english: The police must have a search warrant to search a house.
sentences.chinese: 警察要搜查一座房屋必须有搜查证。

sentences.english: Search can't be committed without search warrant unless in emergency.
sentences.chinese: 搜查要持搜查证才能进行，除非在紧急情况下。

sentences.english: Violation of this regulation will result in the denial of admission.
sentences.chinese: 违反规定经查证属实者，取消其入学资格。

sentences.english: However, it did not report the matter the police will have no check.
sentences.chinese: 但由于对方没有报案，此事警方无从查证。

sentences.english: But the digital trail is littered with intriguing bits of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 但是数字尾迹被有兴趣查证的碎片搞乱了。

sentences.english: Hello, you dial the phone number is empty, please check and then dialing.
sentences.chinese: 您好，您拨打的电话是空号，请查证后再拨。

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to work out who else at Mr Madoff's firm might have had a hand in the affair.
sentences.chinese: 调查者仍在努力查证麦道夫的公司中的其他涉案者。

definition: to investigate and find out/to ascertain
to try to find out/to trace/to track down
to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to screen/to discriminate/to reexamine a case/screening (of applicants etc)
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
